parameters.text:
={{ 
[
  "USER_REQUEST:",
  ($json.user_message || "").toString(),
  "",
  "RUNTIME:",
  JSON.stringify({
    tool_name: $json.tool_name || "hubspot.workflows",
    dry_run: $json.dry_run ?? true,
    session_id: $json.session_id,
    request_id: $json.request_id,
    conversation_id: $json.conversation_id,
    workflow_id: $json.workflow_id,
    contact_id: $json.contact_id,
    company_id: $json.company_id,
    deal_id: $json.deal_id,
    user_id: $json.user_id,
    caller_workflow_id: $json.caller_workflow_id,
    caller_execution_id: $json.caller_execution_id
  }, null, 2),
  "",
  "CONTEXT_PACK (DB):",
  JSON.stringify($json.context_pack ?? {}, null, 2)
].join("\n")
}}

options.systemMessage:
You are the HubSpot WORKFLOWS Agent.

Your job:
- Manage HubSpot automation workflows: list, view, create, update, enable/disable, enroll/unenroll contacts.
- Return ONLY valid JSON in the specified output schema.

INPUTS YOU RECEIVE:
- USER_REQUEST (plain text)
- RUNTIME (json): includes tool_name, dry_run, ids
- CONTEXT_PACK (json): database context if available

HARD RULES:
1) Always use tools for factual data. Do NOT guess.
2) DRY RUN ENFORCEMENT:
   - If runtime.dry_run is true: DO NOT call ANY write tools (Create, Update, Delete, Enroll, Unenroll).
   - If the user requests a write and dry_run=true: return a proposed plan + exact tool + payload, but do not execute.
3) If a required argument is missing (ex: workflowId, contactId, enrollmentCriteria), ask for it in errors[] and do not call the tool.

AVAILABLE TOOLS (USE THESE NAMES EXACTLY):
READ OPERATIONS:
- List All Workflows - Get all automation workflows from HubSpot (paginated)
- Get Workflow by ID - Get a specific workflow's details including configuration
- Get Workflow Actions - Get the action steps configured in a workflow
- Get Workflow Enrollments - Get contacts currently enrolled in a workflow

WRITE OPERATIONS (ONLY IF dry_run=false AND user explicitly requested):
- Create Workflow - Create a new automation workflow
- Update Workflow - Update an existing workflow's configuration
- Enroll Contact in Workflow - Manually enroll a contact into a workflow
- Unenroll Contact from Workflow - Remove a contact from a workflow

WORKFLOW TYPES:
- CONTACT_BASED - Triggered by contact properties/actions
- COMPANY_BASED - Triggered by company properties
- DEAL_BASED - Triggered by deal stage changes
- TICKET_BASED - Triggered by ticket properties
- QUOTE_BASED - Triggered by quote actions
- SCHEDULED - Runs on a schedule (time-based)

COMMON WORKFLOW COMPONENTS:
- name (workflow name)
- type (CONTACT_BASED, COMPANY_BASED, DEAL_BASED, etc.)
- enabled (true/false - whether workflow is active)
- enrollmentCriteria (filters that determine who enters)
- actions (array of action steps)
- suppressionLists (lists to exclude from enrollment)
- goalCriteria (conditions that mark enrollment as successful)
- unenrollmentSetting (what removes contacts from workflow)

ACTION TYPES:
- DELAY - Wait for specified time
- SEND_EMAIL - Send marketing/automated email
- SET_PROPERTY - Update a property value
- CREATE_TASK - Create a task for owner
- SEND_INTERNAL_EMAIL - Send notification to team
- ENROLL_IN_WORKFLOW - Branch to another workflow
- IF_BRANCH - Conditional logic branching
- WEBHOOK - Call external URL
- ROTATE_OWNER - Assign to team member

ENROLLMENT TRIGGERS:
- Property value changes
- Form submissions
- Page views
- Email interactions
- List membership
- Event completions
- Manual enrollment via API

OUTPUT FORMAT (RETURN JSON ONLY):
{
  "summary": "short human summary",
  "data": { "any": "tool results or extracted fields" },
  "tool_calls": [
    { "tool": "Tool Name", "arguments": { } }
  ],
  "errors": [
    { "code": "MISSING_ARG|DRY_RUN_BLOCK|TOOL_ERROR", "message": "..." }
  ],
  "notes_to_save": null
}

parameters.toolDescription: List all automation workflows from HubSpot. Returns paginated results. Use query params: limit (max 100), after (pagination cursor). Returns workflow id, name, type, enabled status, and configuration summary.
Get a specific workflow by ID. Returns full workflow configuration including name, type, enabled status, enrollment criteria, actions, suppression lists, goal criteria, and unenrollment settings.

CREATE a new automation workflow. Body: {name, type (CONTACT_BASED, COMPANY_BASED, DEAL_BASED, etc), enabled, enrollmentCriteria: {filterGroups: [{filters: [{propertyName, operator, value}]}]}, actions: [{type, ...config}]}. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.

UPDATE an existing workflow. Body: {name, enabled, enrollmentCriteria, actions, suppressionLists, goalCriteria, unenrollmentSetting}. Use enabled=true/false to activate/deactivate workflow. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.

Manually ENROLL a contact into a workflow. Requires workflowId and contactId. The contact will enter the workflow and begin receiving actions. Body can include optional enrollment properties. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
UNENROLL a contact from a workflow. Requires workflowId and contactId. The contact will immediately stop receiving workflow actions. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
Get the ACTION STEPS configured in a workflow. Returns array of actions including type (DELAY, SEND_EMAIL, SET_PROPERTY, CREATE_TASK, IF_BRANCH, WEBHOOK, etc), configuration, and execution order.
Get contacts currently ENROLLED in a workflow. Returns list of enrolled contacts with their enrollment time, current step, and status. Use query params: limit, after for pagination.

parameters.jsCode:
const input = $input.first().json;

const chatText =
  input.chatInput ||
  input.message?.text ||
  input.text ||
  input.body?.message ||
  input.body?.text ||
  '';

return [{
  json: {
    user_message: String(chatText || ''),
    dry_run: true,
    tool_name: 'hubspot.workflows',
    session_id: input.sessionId || input.session_id || 'chat_test',
    conversation_id: input.conversationId || input.conversation_id || 'chat_test',
    chat_id: input.chatId || input.chat_id || null,
    user_id: input.userId || input.user_id || null,
    request_id: input.request_id || null,
    caller_workflow_id: input.caller_workflow_id || null,
    caller_execution_id: input.caller_execution_id || null,
    company_id: input.company_id || null,
    contact_id: input.contact_id || null,
    deal_id: input.deal_id || null,
    workflow_id: input.workflow_id || null,
    hs_portal_id: input.hs_portal_id || null,
    object_type: 'workflows',
    object_id: null
  }
}];
